intro: Dichromanthus michuacanus, commonly known as the Michuacan dichromanthus, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking two-colored flowers, typically featuring a contrasting red and yellow or white coloration. It grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to survive in dry conditions. Its unique floral structure and coloration make it a notable species in botanical studies.
